comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lord_Alfred_Douglas www.anthonywynn.com/bosiebibliography/ www.alfreddouglas.com/ The last site has what looks like the same photo but a different scan. Probably Bain used a copy of a formal portrait.

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: The 1923 date probably relates to Douglas being found guilty of libelling Winston Churchill and spending six months in jail.

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: I find myself wondering if this photo might be found in lccn.loc.gov/14014132, a 1914 publication, Oscar Wilde and myself, by Lord Alfred Douglas, with portrait of the author and thirteen other portraits and illustrations, also facsimile letters. www.anthonywynn.com/bosiebibliography/ shows the photo and states that it was in 1914, but provides no evidence for the date.

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content: Oscar Wilde sacrificed his life and career for this worthless nonentity.
